panels.description: The percentage of the time during which Scylla utilized the CPU. Note that because Scylla does busy polling for some time before going idle, CPU utilization as seen by the operating system may be much higher. Your system is not yet CPU-bottlenecked until this metric is high.
panels.title: Load

panels.description: Write attempts - include all writes that reached the coordinator node, even if they will eventually fail
panels.title: Writes

panels.description: Read attempts - include all reads that reached the coordinator node, even if they will eventually fail
panels.title: Reads

options.content:
Balance

An Imbalance between shards or nodes may indicates a potential problem

value.title: Open an issue
value.url: https://github.com/scylladb/scylla/issues/new?body=description%3D${__data.fields[4]}%0ASource%3DAdvisor%0AScylla-versions%3D${all_scyllas_versions}%0Ascylla-monitoring%3D${monitoring_version}%0Acluster%3D${count_dc}%0Aname%3D${cluster}%0A%0A<!--%0ATo help us understand the issue, please upload a copy of your metrics to our secure location.%0AYou can read about it here: https://docs.scylladb.com/troubleshooting/report_scylla_problem/%0A%0AYou can use the upload_report.sh utility that is part of scylla-monitoring stack.%0AMake sure to include the UUID you got from the utility in this issue.%0A-->

targets.expr: max(abs(rate(scylla_cql_updates{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m]) - on(dc) group_left avg(rate(scylla_cql_updates{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m])) by (dc))/on(dc) group_left sum(stddev(rate(scylla_cql_updates{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m])) by(dc)+100) by(dc))-3

max(abs(rate(scylla_cql_inserts{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m]) - on(dc) group_left avg(rate(scylla_cql_inserts{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m])) by (dc))/on(dc) group_left sum(stddev(rate(scylla_cql_inserts{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m])) by(dc)+100) by(dc))-3

max(abs(rate(scylla_cql_reads{ dc=~"$dc"}[1m]) - on(dc) group_left avg(rate(scylla_cql_reads{ dc=~"$dc"}[1m])) by (dc))/on(dc) group_left sum(stddev(rate(scylla_cql_reads{ dc=~"$dc"}[1m])) by(dc)+100) by(dc))-3

max(abs(rate(scylla_cql_deletes{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m]) - on(dc) group_left avg(rate(scylla_cql_deletes{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m])) by (dc))/on(dc) group_left sum(stddev(rate(scylla_cql_deletes{conditional="no",  dc=~"$dc"}[1m])) by(dc)+100) by(dc))-3

panels.description: A shard that reads more from the cache could be an indication for hot partition
panels.title: Cache

panels.description: A single shard that reads more from sstables, could be that a node is slow
panels.title: SSTable

panels.description: The Hits and Misses
panels.title: Cache Rows Hits/Misses

panels.description: Write attempts - include all writes that reached the coordinator node, even if they will eventually fail
panels.title: Writes

panels.description: Requests that Scylla tried to write but timed out. Timeouts are counted in the node that received the request (the coordinator), not at the replicas.
panels.title: Write Timeouts by [[by]]

panels.description: Requests that Scylla tried to read but timed out. Timeouts are counted in the node that received the request (the coordinator), not at the replicas.
panels.title: Read Timeouts by [[by]]

panels.description: The Hits and Misses
panels.title: Cache Reads Hits/Misses

panels.description: Read attempts - include all reads that reached the coordinator node, even if they will eventually fail
panels.title: Reads

panels.description: Number of CQL INSERT commands generated by the user
panels.title: CQL Insert

panels.title: CQL Reads

panels.description: Number of CQL DELETE commands generated by the user

panels.description: Number of CQL UPDATE commands generated by the user
panels.title: CQL Updates

panels.description: amount of CQL connections currently established
panels.title: Client CQL connections by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of CQL batches command, each batched command is counted once
panels.title: CQL Batches by [[by]]

panels.description: Number of CQL command batched. Each batch would add the number of commands inside the batch
panels.title: CQL Command In Batches by [[by]]

panels.description: Counts the number of SELECT statements with BYPASS CACHE option
panels.title: BYPASS CACHE

panels.description: CQL errors by type, only active errors are shown
panels.title: CQL Errors [[by]]

panels.description: Number of CQL row reads
panels.title: CQL Row Reads [[by]]

panels.description: Number of reads using secondary indexes
panels.title: Secondary indexes Reads [[by]]
